diseases.name: influenza
diseases.description: Influenza is a viral infection that attacks the respiratory system.
diseases.transmission: Airborne droplets when an infected person coughs, sneezes, or talks.
diseases.symptoms: Fever, chills, muscle aches, cough, congestion, runny nose, headaches, and fatigue.
diseases.treatment: Antiviral medications, rest, hydration, and over-the-counter medications for symptom relief.

diseases.name: covid-19
diseases.description: COVID-19 is a respiratory illness caused by the SARS-CoV-2 virus.
diseases.transmission: Spread through respiratory droplets and contact with contaminated surfaces.
diseases.symptoms: Fever, cough, difficulty breathing, fatigue, and loss of taste or smell.
diseases.treatment: Supportive care, oxygen therapy, and antiviral medications in severe cases.

diseases.name: tuberculosis
diseases.description: Tuberculosis (TB) is a potentially serious infectious disease that mainly affects the lungs.
diseases.transmission: Airborne when an infected person coughs or sneezes.
diseases.symptoms: Coughing that lasts three or more weeks, coughing up blood, chest pain, and unintentional weight loss.
diseases.treatment: Long-term antibiotics treatment, typically for 6-9 months.

diseases.name: hepatitis B
diseases.description: Hepatitis B is a serious liver infection caused by the hepatitis B virus (HBV).
diseases.transmission: Contact with infectious body fluids, such as blood and semen.
diseases.symptoms: Yellowing of the eyes, abdominal pain, and dark urine.
diseases.treatment: Antiviral medications, liver transplant in severe cases.

diseases.name: malaria
diseases.description: Malaria is a disease caused by a plasmodium parasite, transmitted by the bite of infected mosquitoes.
diseases.transmission: Bites from Anopheles mosquitoes.
diseases.symptoms: Fever, chills, and flu-like illness.
diseases.treatment: Antimalarial medications.

diseases.name: measles
diseases.description: Measles is a highly contagious viral disease.
diseases.transmission: Airborne droplets from coughs and sneezes of infected individuals.
diseases.symptoms: Fever, dry cough, runny nose, inflamed eyes, sore throat, and a red, blotchy skin rash.
diseases.treatment: Supportive care including rest, fluids, and pain relievers.

diseases.name: chickenpox
diseases.description: Chickenpox is a viral infection that causes an itchy rash with small, fluid-filled blisters.
diseases.transmission: Direct contact with the rash or through airborne transmission of respiratory droplets.
diseases.symptoms: Itchy rash, fever, tiredness, and loss of appetite.
diseases.treatment: Antiviral medication, calamine lotion, and oatmeal baths to relieve itching.

diseases.name: mumps
diseases.description: Mumps is a viral infection that affects the salivary glands.
diseases.transmission: Spread through infected saliva.
diseases.symptoms: Swollen salivary glands, fever, headache, muscle aches, and fatigue.
diseases.treatment: Supportive care including rest, fluids, and pain relievers.

diseases.name: rubella
diseases.description: Rubella is a contagious viral infection best known by its distinctive red rash.
diseases.transmission: Airborne droplets from coughs and sneezes of infected individuals.
diseases.symptoms: Mild fever, headache, red eyes, and a fine, pink rash.
diseases.treatment: Supportive care including rest, fluids, and pain relievers.

diseases.name: dengue fever
diseases.description: Dengue fever is a mosquito-borne tropical disease caused by the dengue virus.
diseases.transmission: Bites from Aedes mosquitoes.
diseases.symptoms: High fever, headache, vomiting, muscle and joint pains, and a characteristic skin rash.
diseases.treatment: Supportive care including rest, fluids, and pain relievers.

diseases.name: zika virus
diseases.description: Zika virus is a mosquito-borne viral infection.
diseases.transmission: Bites from Aedes mosquitoes, mother-to-child, sexual contact, and blood transfusions.
diseases.symptoms: Mild fever, rash, conjunctivitis, muscle and joint pain, malaise, and headache.
diseases.treatment: Supportive care including rest, fluids, and pain relievers.

diseases.name: ebola
diseases.description: Ebola virus disease is a severe, often fatal illness in humans.
diseases.transmission: Contact with blood, secretions, organs, or other bodily fluids of infected animals or humans.
diseases.symptoms: Fever, severe headache, muscle pain, weakness, fatigue, diarrhea, vomiting, abdominal pain, and unexplained hemorrhaging.
diseases.treatment: Supportive care including fluids and electrolytes, oxygen therapy, and medications to support blood pressure, reduce vomiting and diarrhea, and manage fever and pain.

diseases.name: hiv
diseases.description: HIV is a virus that attacks the immune system, and AIDS is the final stage of HIV infection.
diseases.transmission: Contact with infected blood, semen, vaginal fluids, and breast milk.
diseases.symptoms: Fever, chills, rash, night sweats, muscle aches, sore throat, fatigue, swollen lymph nodes, and mouth ulcers.
diseases.treatment: Antiretroviral therapy (ART) to control the virus.

diseases.name: aids
diseases.description: HIV is a virus that attacks the immune system, and AIDS is the final stage of HIV infection.
diseases.transmission: Contact with infected blood, semen, vaginal fluids, and breast milk.
diseases.symptoms: Fever, chills, rash, night sweats, muscle aches, sore throat, fatigue, swollen lymph nodes, and mouth ulcers.
diseases.treatment: Antiretroviral therapy (ART) to control the virus.

diseases.name: cholera
diseases.description: Cholera is an infectious disease that causes severe watery diarrhea.
diseases.transmission: Ingesting contaminated food or water.
diseases.symptoms: Severe watery diarrhea, vomiting, and leg cramps.
diseases.treatment: Rehydration solutions, intravenous fluids, and antibiotics in severe cases.

diseases.name: typhoid fever
diseases.description: Typhoid fever is a bacterial infection that can spread throughout the body.
diseases.transmission: Ingesting contaminated food or water.
diseases.symptoms: Prolonged fever, fatigue, headache, nausea, abdominal pain, and constipation or diarrhea.
diseases.treatment: Antibiotics and supportive care including fluids and rest.

diseases.name: plague
diseases.description: Plague is a bacterial infection found in rodents and their fleas.
diseases.transmission: Bites from infected fleas, contact with contaminated fluid or tissue, and inhalation of respiratory droplets from infected individuals.
diseases.symptoms: Fever, headache, chills, weakness, and swollen, painful lymph nodes.
diseases.treatment: Antibiotics and supportive care.

diseases.name: diabetes
diseases.description: Diabetes is a disease that occurs when your blood glucose is too high.
diseases.transmission: Not transmissible; influenced by genetics, lifestyle, and environment.
diseases.symptoms: Increased thirst, frequent urination, extreme hunger, and fatigue.
diseases.treatment: Insulin therapy, oral medications, lifestyle changes, and monitoring blood sugar levels.

diseases.name: hypertension
diseases.description: Hypertension, or high blood pressure, is a condition in which the force of the blood against the artery walls is too high.
diseases.transmission: Not transmissible; influenced by lifestyle and genetics.
diseases.symptoms: Often asymptomatic; can include headaches, shortness of breath, or nosebleeds.
diseases.treatment: Medications, dietary changes, exercise, and stress management.

diseases.name: asthma
diseases.description: Asthma is a condition in which your airways narrow and swell and may produce extra mucus.
diseases.transmission: Not transmissible; triggered by environmental factors and genetics.
diseases.symptoms: Shortness of breath, chest tightness, wheezing, and coughing.
diseases.treatment: Inhalers, long-term asthma control medications, and avoiding triggers.

diseases.name: heart disease
diseases.description: Heart disease describes a range of conditions that affect your heart, including coronary artery disease, arrhythmias, and congenital heart defects.
diseases.transmission: Not transmissible; influenced by lifestyle and genetics.
diseases.symptoms: Chest pain, shortness of breath, and pain, numbness, weakness or coldness in your legs or arms.
diseases.treatment: Lifestyle changes, medications, and surgical procedures.

diseases.name: chronic kidney disease
diseases.description: Chronic kidney disease involves a gradual loss of kidney function.
diseases.transmission: Not transmissible; influenced by diabetes, high blood pressure, and other risk factors.
diseases.symptoms: Nausea, vomiting, loss of appetite, fatigue, and changes in urine output.
diseases.treatment: Medications, lifestyle changes, dialysis, or kidney transplant.

diseases.name: arthritis
diseases.description: Arthritis is inflammation of one or more of your joints.
diseases.transmission: Not transmissible; influenced by age, genetics, and lifestyle.
diseases.symptoms: Joint pain, stiffness, swelling, and decreased range of motion.
diseases.treatment: Medications, physical therapy, and sometimes surgery.

diseases.name: chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD)
diseases.description: COPD is a chronic inflammatory lung disease that causes obstructed airflow from the lungs.
diseases.transmission: Not transmissible; primarily caused by long-term exposure to irritating gases or particulate matter, most often from cigarette smoke.
diseases.symptoms: Breathing difficulty, cough, mucus production, and wheezing.
diseases.treatment: Inhalers, medications, pulmonary rehabilitation, and oxygen therapy.

diseases.name: osteoporosis
diseases.description: Osteoporosis is a disease where decreased bone strength increases the risk of a broken bone.
diseases.transmission: Not transmissible; influenced by age, genetics, and lifestyle.
diseases.symptoms: Bone fractures, loss of height, back pain, and a hunched posture.
diseases.treatment: Medications, calcium and vitamin D supplements, and lifestyle changes.

diseases.name: alzheimers disease
diseases.description: Alzheimer's disease is a progressive disorder that causes brain cells to waste away (degenerate) and die.
diseases.transmission: Not transmissible; influenced by genetics, age, and other risk factors.
diseases.symptoms: Memory loss, confusion, difficulty with thinking and understanding, and changes in behavior.
diseases.treatment: Medications, cognitive therapies, and supportive care.

diseases.name: parkinsons disease
diseases.description: Parkinson's disease is a progressive nervous system disorder that affects movement.
diseases.transmission: Not transmissible; influenced by genetics and environmental factors.
diseases.symptoms: Tremors, stiffness, slow movement, and balance problems.
diseases.treatment: Medications, physical therapy, and sometimes surgery.

diseases.name: multiple sclerosis
diseases.description: Multiple sclerosis (MS) is a disease in which the immune system eats away at the protective covering of nerves.
diseases.transmission: Not transmissible; influenced by genetics and environmental factors.
diseases.symptoms: Fatigue, difficulty walking, numbness or tingling, muscle weakness, and vision problems.
diseases.treatment: Medications, physical therapy, and lifestyle changes.

diseases.name: epilepsy
diseases.description: Epilepsy is a central nervous system disorder in which brain activity becomes abnormal, causing seizures.
diseases.transmission: Not transmissible; influenced by genetics, head trauma, and other factors.
diseases.symptoms: Seizures, temporary confusion, staring spells, and uncontrollable jerking movements.
diseases.treatment: Medications, surgery, and sometimes dietary changes.

diseases.name: lupus
diseases.description: Lupus is a systemic autoimmune disease that occurs when your body's immune system attacks your own tissues and organs.
diseases.transmission: Not transmissible; influenced by genetics, hormones, and environmental factors.
diseases.symptoms: Fatigue, joint pain, skin rashes, and fever.
diseases.treatment: Medications, lifestyle changes, and supportive care.

diseases.name: crohns disease
diseases.description: Crohn's disease is a type of inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) that can affect any part of the gastrointestinal tract.
diseases.transmission: Not transmissible; influenced by genetics and environmental factors.
diseases.symptoms: Diarrhea, abdominal pain, weight loss, anemia, and fatigue.
diseases.treatment: Medications, dietary changes, and sometimes surgery.

diseases.name: ulcerative colitis
diseases.description: Ulcerative colitis is a chronic inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) that causes inflammation and ulcers in the digestive tract.
diseases.transmission: Not transmissible; influenced by genetics and environmental factors.
diseases.symptoms: Diarrhea, abdominal pain, rectal bleeding, and weight loss.
diseases.treatment: Medications, dietary changes, and sometimes surgery.

diseases.name: celiac disease
diseases.description: Celiac disease is an immune reaction to eating gluten, a protein found in wheat, barley, and rye.
diseases.transmission: Not transmissible; influenced by genetics and environmental factors.
diseases.symptoms: Diarrhea, bloating, gas, fatigue, and anemia.
diseases.treatment: A strict gluten-free diet.

diseases.name: sickle cell disease
diseases.description: Sickle cell disease is a group of inherited red blood cell disorders.
diseases.transmission: Genetic inheritance.
diseases.symptoms: Anemia, episodes of pain, swelling of hands and feet, frequent infections, and delayed growth.
diseases.treatment: Medications, blood transfusions, and sometimes bone marrow transplant.

diseases.name: hemophilia
diseases.description: Hemophilia is a rare disorder in which your blood doesn't clot normally because it lacks sufficient blood-clotting proteins.
diseases.transmission: Genetic inheritance.
diseases.symptoms: Excessive bleeding, easy bruising, and joint pain.
diseases.treatment: Replacement therapy with clotting factor concentrates.

diseases.name: anemia
diseases.description: Anemia is a condition in which you lack enough healthy red blood cells to carry adequate oxygen to your body's tissues.
diseases.transmission: Not transmissible; caused by a variety of factors including nutritional deficiencies and chronic diseases.
diseases.symptoms: Fatigue, weakness, pale skin, and shortness of breath.
diseases.treatment: Dietary changes, supplements, medications, and sometimes blood transfusions.

diseases.name: psoriasis
diseases.description: Psoriasis is a skin disease that causes red, itchy scaly patches, most commonly on the knees, elbows, trunk, and scalp.
diseases.transmission: Not transmissible; influenced by genetics and environmental factors.
diseases.symptoms: Red patches of skin covered with thick, silvery scales, dry, cracked skin that may bleed, and itching or burning.
diseases.treatment: Topical treatments, phototherapy, and systemic medications.
